title: Sen. Rand Paul Presses Transgender Health Nominee About Treatment in Children
sub_head: Hearing for Biden nominee for assistant health secretary turns tense as she is pressed over her stance on gender dysphoria treatment for minors
body:
A hearing for a transgender person nominated by President Biden for a top administration health position turned tense Thursday as she was pressed over her stance on gender dysphoria treatment for minors.
Republican Sen. Rand Paul of Kentucky started his questioning by mentioning “genital mutilation” to Dr. Rachel Levine, the nominee for assistant health secretary.
He then asked her during Thursday’s Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee hearing if she supports hormone therapy or sex-reassignment therapy in minors with gender dysphoria. “We should be outraged that someone’s talking to a three year old about changing their sex,” said Mr. Paul, an ophthalmologist.
Mr. Paul added, “You give a woman enough testosterone to grow a beard, you think she’ll go back?”
Gender dysphoria—a conflict between a person’s sex assigned at birth and the gender with which a person identifies—is recognized by the American Psychiatric Association and other professional associations as a medical issue.
